intro: Micropeuce, commonly known as the common micropeuce, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a slightly aromatic scent when crushed. Micropeuce is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
